intro: Antennaria greenei, commonly known as the Greene's mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant has hairy, lobed leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine and subalpine regions. Antennaria greenei is typically short-lived and reproduces through seeds, making it a rare and ecologically significant species in its habitat.
